@Everyone who gets a non-supported device error

Perhaps it's obvious to everyone, but I'm a n00b, so it took me awhile to figure out.

If you previously had SRS installed, make sure you change to a different default sound driver in the sound control panel before updating.

If you don't the installation goes all funny and it won't load up properly.

Anyways, 100% Working and Clean.

You'll get false positives on the keygen, but that's expected.

Oh and I'm not sure why, but if you have other sound drivers installed from stuff like "Tunebite" and "Total Recorder," it confuses SRS or something.

So I had to uninstall them for SRS to work properly.

Aoloffline, thanks for the file man. It works great!!! The application file is authentic from SRS. Reg Key was tested with Bitdefender Internet Security 2010, and came up clean. No problems at all. First, install SRS. Second, go into settings to disable "automatic updates." Then, go into your firewall settings to DENY SRS access to the internet. Then, Reboot computer. Next, use reg key to register MANUAL/OFFLINE. Make sure there's no internet connection when applying the reg key information.

Hot damn, you ain't kidding when it read as "an improved bass and better dialog quality"! This is like a silver screen theater's sound system in my head and I love it! I absolutely love the Extra Bass setting in the Music's audio Preset! This one is sooooo much better and significantly better than the older SRS version I had unlocked which was probably like version 1.4 or something. Highly recommended guys!

When you install this one people, go to the Application 1st and copy the Product ID into the Keygen 1st! Then go back to the Keygen and copy/paste the keys from the keygen to the Application and voila, you're done!

Tons of thanks to you AolOffline, you are the shit!

I forgot to mention....
Update to Activation problems you guys might have:

If you follow my directions and copy the Product ID from the Application into the keygen, click generate, then copy/paste everything else from the keygen back to the Application.... DO NOT need to turn off your internet connection to activate it, there is NO need to do so because it CAN be activated without turning off your internet connection!! It worked for me in less than 10 seconds!

Same thing happened to me too. When i instaled the srs audio soundbox it worked great but when i shut my pc down and opened it again I couldn't hear any sound so i had to delete it. I'm using win 7 32bit home premium edition

WOW! fast download and it works great on my Win 7 64.

Now for those of you who encounter sudden lost of audio after running the SRS Audio Sound Box here a suggestion because I also encounter it too.

On the SRS Audio Sound Box window there's a big ass play button top and next to it is Options. Click Options and Select Preferences, once in, under Devices there's a drop down. Mine was defaulted to Realtek HDA Primary output so I change it to Realtek HDA Audio 2nd output because I'm using headphone and works like charm.

Note that when SRS Audio Sound Box is open it overrides the default of Realtek HD Audio Manager. Open your Realtek HD Audio Manager and you can see that Speakers and HD Audio 2nd output is not check. Check one and your audio will be back but not with SRS WOW effect just the original.

HOPE that helps and Thanks  Uploader.

WOW! fast download and it works great on my Win 7 64.

Now for those of you who encounter sudden lost of audio after running the SRS Audio Sound Box here a suggestion because I also encounter it too.

On the SRS Audio Sound Box window there's a big ass play button top and next to it is Options. Click Options and Select Preferences, once in, under Devices there's a drop down. Mine was defaulted to Realtek HDA Primary output so I change it to Realtek HDA Audio 2nd output because I'm using headphone and works like charm.

Note that when SRS Audio Sound Box is open it overrides the default of Realtek HD Audio Manager. Open your Realtek HD Audio Manager and you can see that Speakers and HD Audio 2nd output is not check. Check one and your audio will be back but not with SRS WOW effect just the original.

I got the built-in soundcard of my laptop (Realtek HD Optical Audio) connected with my Hi-Fi amplifier (using optical cable) so I always get Dolby Digital through the speakers (2 main, 2 rear, 1 center and subwoofer) of my 1st class Hi-Fi. A lustful sound that fills my livingroom... I thought that it could be even better using this tool, but nothing can be further from the truth. Although clean torrent without virus/trojan (great work, uploader!) the problem is that - using this SRS thingy - my Dolby Digital is gone but all sound comes through my tiny hidden laptop speakers. My RT optical HD soundcard is merely disabled. Sounds awful! So I don't use it anymore currently... but has anyone an idea how to solve this, so I can still improve sound quality? My goal: perfection / comfort in sound!
